trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Radoll Ja seeks someone well-liked by the locals.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_TODO_00<tab>Question the inhabitants of Ok'hanu.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Radoll Ja.

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_000<tab>You travel with the Third Promise, don't you? I've heard stories, but it's an honor to meet you in the flesh, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I know you're a busy <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var>, but might I have a moment of your time?

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_001<tab>I serve the Dawnservant, and am come here in an effort to catalog the traditional magicks of our continent. In particular, I'm interested in how the Hanuhanu weave the energies of wind.

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_002<tab>Competing to see who can float a feather the furthest seems to be a favored pastime of the Hanu, which demonstrates their mastery over wind. Yet I've no notion as to <var 1A 02 /var>how<var 1A 01 /var> they achieve this mastery.

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_003<tab>My best theory is that they undergo intensive training from a young age, but as a recent arrival here, prying into such matters may come off as presumptuous. But you have their trust─might you ask in my stead?

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_004<tab>I fear I'd fast become an unwelcome guest if I were to ask the Hanuhanu about their sacred traditions. But you have won their trust─perhaps they'll be forthcoming about how their mastery of wind is won.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_GINUHALI_000_005<tab>Why does the wind heed us? Why, because we consume the blessing of reeds bestowed upon us by Kozama'uka!
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_GINUHALI_000_006<tab>The energy suffused in the earth flows into the reeds, and the reeds flow into our bellies. By that cycle we are gifted with the land's strength.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_GINUHALI_000_007<tab>In other words, the reeds are far more than mere sustenance─they are the very wellspring of our power!

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_OONUHALI_000_008<tab>I never considered <var 1A 02 /var>why<var 1A 01 /var> we are so attuned to the wind, but now that you ask...it must be thanks to our daily meditations and rigorous training!
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_OONUHALI_000_009<tab>By listening carefully to the wind's whispers, one can discern the path of its flow, and in so doing achieve total harmony with one's surroundings.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_OONUHALI_000_010<tab>This understanding allows us to summon gales mighty enough to chase clouds from the sky!

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_TONAHANU_000_011<tab>I'm heartened that you would show such interest in our ways. Many know that the Hanuhanu have a deep connection to the wind, but few care to ask how that connection is made.

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_TONAHANU_000_012<tab>That being said, it's a question without a single answer. However, I would say that our feathers are the most important tool we have for comprehending the wind's movements.

TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_TONAHANU_000_013<tab>They're more than just for show─they allow us to sense even the smallest shift in the wind's temperament, and that awareness allows us to direct it as we see fit.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_GINUHALI_000_014<tab>The reeds put us in tune with the land's energy, and its strength becomes our own. Strength enough to direct the winds!
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_OONUHALI_000_015<tab>Every Hanuhanu must spend long hours listening to the whispers of the wind. Only then can they call themselves masters!
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_TONAHANU_000_016<tab>Our feathers allow us to feel even the smallest shift in the wind's direction, and that awareness gives us command over it.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_017<tab>You are returned. Were the Hanuhanu forthcoming with their knowledge?
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_018<tab>I see... So there isn't one key to their expertise, but many. Each one forged by their singular bodies, culture, and environment.
TEXT_KINGZC006_05065_RADOLLJA_000_019<tab>I believe you've given me a starting point from which I can launch a more thorough investigation. Thank you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
